Why to use library for modals at all? What's the advantage? This is a little provocative question :slightly_smiling_face:
If I think of a modal is just an overlay that you can fire away with a button click
It handles aria parameters/accessibility automatically, it's a small library btw so not a big impact on js bundle size

Hey everyone! I'm working on an integration with the HubSpot Webhooks API where I wanna know whenever a Contact unsubscribes from emails. The issue I'm facing is that when creating a new subscription in my Webhooks App I can't find any property that will allow me to receive this information in my endpoint. Tried both `contact.propertyChanged` and `contact.associationChanged` and none worked. Is this just not implemented yet? Any tips?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
